chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradly Shawn Bulloch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Submit DNA sample. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Complete domestic abuse counseling. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Bradly Shawn Bulloch
Current: 140 Athens Dr., Rio, WI 53960 United States  (Effective: 10-26-2022)
Prior: Homeless, Portage, WI 53901
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by Atty Allison Borsheim

9:51 AM Cases called: 22CF355, 22CF363. 22CF543, 22CF548, and 22CM254. Defendant Bradly Shawn Bulloch in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Bradly Shawn Bulloch.  Attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for State of Wisconsin. In 22CF548 Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Agreement recited by State. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled guilty to count 1 of 22CF355, count 2 of 22CF548, and count 2 of 22CM254. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. All remaining charges and cases dismissed and read in. Sentencing statements. In 22CF548 and 22CF355: Court withheld sentence placed the defendant on probation for 36 months each case. In 22CM254; Court withheld sentence, placed the defendant on probation for 24 months. Conditions of probation in all cases include: Submit DNA sample. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Complete domestic abuse counseling. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Costs in 22CF548 of $518.00, 22CF355 $518.00 and 22CM254 $543.00. Jail credit in 22CF548 44 days, 22CF363 56 days, 22CF355 3 days, 22CM254 2 days, and 22CF543 44 days. 10:19 AM
